title: Is the solution to gerrymandering … more gerrymandering?
description:
Every ten years, states redraw their political lines and so far, about two-thirds of states have adopted their new congressional district maps. But there’s one thing we know already — the biggest loss won’t be among districts with solid red or solid blue voters. It will among be the competitive districts.

Chuck talks with Michael Li, senior counsel at the Brennan Center, and Dante Chinni, founder of the American Communities Project and the brain behind Data Download.
